nz.ac.auckland.morc

Class MorcBuilder<Builder extends MorcBuilder<Builder>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nz.ac.auckland.morc.MorcBuilder<Builder>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockDefinition.MockDefinitionBuilderInit, OrchestratedTestSpecification.OrchestratedTestSpecificationBuilderInit

    public class MorcBuilder<Builder extends MorcBuilder<Builder>>
extends Object
    The root builder for specifying processors and predicates for message publishers and mock definitions
    Author:
    David MacDonald - d.macdonald@auckland.ac.nz

      Builder addPredicates(org.apache.camel.Predicate... predicates)
      Add a set of predicates to validate an incoming exchange - all predicates in a single call apply ONLY to a single message, add consecutive calls to addPredicates in order to handle further messages

    • Method Detail

      • addProcessors

        public Builder addProcessors(org.apache.camel.Processor... processors)
        Adds processors for populating a series of exchanges with an outgoing message - all processors in a single call apply ONLY to a single message, add consecutive calls to addProcessors in order to handle further messages
        Parameters:
        processors - A list of processors that will handle a separate exchange (in order)

      • addProcessors

        public Builder addProcessors(int index,
                             org.apache.camel.Processor... processors)
        Add a set of processors to handle an outgoing exchange at a particular offset (n'th message)
        Parameters:
        index - The exchange offset that these processors should be applied to
        processors - The processors that will handle populating the exchange with an appropriate outgoing value

      • addRepeatedProcessor

        public Builder addRepeatedProcessor(org.apache.camel.Processor processor)
        Parameters:
        processor - A processor that will be applied to every outgoing message but won't create any exchanges

      • processorMultiplier

        public Builder processorMultiplier(int count,
                                   org.apache.camel.Processor... processors)
        Replay the same processor for the specified number of times (requests or inputs)
        Parameters:
        count - The number of times to repeat these processors (separate requests)
        processors - A collection of processors that will be applied to an exchange before it is sent

      • addPredicates

        public Builder addPredicates(org.apache.camel.Predicate... predicates)
        Add a set of predicates to validate an incoming exchange - all predicates in a single call apply ONLY to a single message, add consecutive calls to addPredicates in order to handle further messages
        Parameters:
        predicates - A list of predicates that will validate a separate exchange (in order)

      • addPredicates

        public Builder addPredicates(int index,
                             org.apache.camel.Predicate... predicates)
        Add a set of predicates to validate an exchange at a particular offset (n'th message)
        Parameters:
        index - The exchange offset that these predicates should be validated against
        predicates - The set of predicates that will do the validation of the exchange

      • addRepeatedPredicate

        public Builder addRepeatedPredicate(org.apache.camel.Predicate predicate)
        Parameters:
        predicate - A predicate that will be used to validate every exchange but won't create any expectations to start with

      • predicateMultiplier

        public Builder predicateMultiplier(int count,
                                   org.apache.camel.Predicate... predicates)
        Expect a repeat of the same predicates multiple times
        Parameters:
        count - The number of times to repeat these predicates (separate responses)
        predicates - The set of response validators/predicates that will be used to validate consecutive responses

      • getProcessors

        protected List<org.apache.camel.Processor> getProcessors()
        Returns:
        A list of processors that will be used to handle each exchange; note that a single Processor is returned that effectively wraps all of the processors provided to the builder (including repeated processors)

      • getProcessors

        protected List<org.apache.camel.Processor> getProcessors(int expectedSize)
        Parameters:
        expectedSize - The number of processors that we expect to exist, and the collection will be padded to this size
        Returns:
        A list of processors that will be used to handle each exchange; note that a single Processor is returned that effectively wraps all of the processors provided to the builder (including repeated processors). Repeated processors are evaluated first.

      • getPredicates

        protected List<org.apache.camel.Predicate> getPredicates()
        Returns:
        A list of predicates that will be used to validate each exchange; note that a single Predicate is returned that effectively wraps all of the predicates provided to the builder (including repeated predicates)

      • getPredicates

        protected List<org.apache.camel.Predicate> getPredicates(int expectedSize)
        Parameters:
        expectedSize - The number of predicates that we expect to exist, and the collection will be padded to this size
        Returns:
        A list of predicates that will be used to validate each exchange; note that a Predicate is returned that effectively wraps all of the predicates provided to the builder (including repeated predicates). Repeated predicates are evaluated first.

      • addEndpointOverride

        public Builder addEndpointOverride(EndpointOverride override)
        Parameters:
        override - An override used for modifying an endpoint with sensible properties

      • getEndpointOverrides

        public Collection<EndpointOverride> getEndpointOverrides()
        Returns:
        The endpoint overrides that will be used to modify endpoint properties

      • messageResultWaitTime

        public Builder messageResultWaitTime(long messageResultWaitTime)
        Parameters:
        messageResultWaitTime - The maximum amount of time in milliseconds per message that the test will wait for a result to be provided (this will be multiplied by the expected number of messages to give a maximum wait time for all messages to be handled)

      • getMessageResultWaitTime

        public long getMessageResultWaitTime()
        Returns:
        The maximum amount of time in milliseconds per message that the test will wait for a result to be provided (this will be multiplied by the expected number of messages to give a maximum wait time for all messages to be handled)

      • minimalResultWaitTime

        public Builder minimalResultWaitTime(long minimalResultWaitTime)
        Parameters:
        minimalResultWaitTime - The minimum time in milliseconds for forming a maximum time that a test will wait for all messages to arrive/complete. This is usually used as a buffer time for ensuring a route has started before the messageResultWaitTime values are accounted for

      • getMinimalResultWaitTime

        public long getMinimalResultWaitTime()
        Returns:
        The minimum time in milliseconds for forming a maximum time that a test will wait for all messages to arrive/complete. This is usually used as a buffer time for ensuring a route has started before the messageResultWaitTime values are accounted for

      • getEndpointUri

        public String getEndpointUri()
        Returns:
        The endpoint URI that this definition expects to act against

      • getMockFeedPreprocessor

        public org.apache.camel.Processor getMockFeedPreprocessor()
        Returns:
        A processor that will be applied before the exchange is sent through to the mock endpoint

      • addMockFeedPreprocessor

        public Builder addMockFeedPreprocessor(org.apache.camel.Processor... mockFeedPreprocessors)
        Parameters:
        mockFeedPreprocessors - A list processor that will be applied before the exchange is sent through to the mock endpoint
